data.route_analysis: Guatemala offers multiple transportation options including buses and shuttles which connect major cities and attractions. Domestic flights are also available for quicker transit. Popular routes include Antigua to Lake Atitlán and Tikal to Flores.
data.pricing_trends: Flight prices fluctuate based on the season, with higher rates during the dry season. On average, prices range from $400 to $800 for round trips from the US.
data.seasonal_patterns: Peak travel months are December to April (dry season) while May to October experiences more rain, impacting travel plans.
data.booking_windows: Optimal booking time is 3-6 months prior to travel for the best deals. Last-minute bookings may result in higher prices due to increased demand.

destination_insights.route_analysis: Guatemala offers multiple transportation options including buses and shuttles which connect major cities and attractions. Domestic flights are also available for quicker transit. Popular routes include Antigua to Lake Atitlán and Tikal to Flores.
destination_insights.seasonal_patterns: Peak travel months are December to April (dry season) while May to October experiences more rain, impacting travel plans.
destination_insights.climate: Guatemala has a tropical climate with a wet and dry season. Temperatures vary greatly by altitude; cooler in the highlands and warmer in coastal areas. Recommended to visit during the dry season for better weather, especially for outdoor activities.
destination_insights.culture: Guatemala is rich in Mayan heritage with vibrant local traditions. Important events include Semana Santa (Holy Week) and the Day of the Dead celebrations, showcasing colorful parades and rituals.

market_insights.pricing_trends: Flight prices fluctuate based on the season, with higher rates during the dry season. On average, prices range from $400 to $800 for round trips from the US.
market_insights.booking_windows: Optimal booking time is 3-6 months prior to travel for the best deals. Last-minute bookings may result in higher prices due to increased demand.
market_insights.demand: Guatemala's popularity has grown among adventure travelers and those interested in cultural experiences. Recent trends show increased interest in eco-tourism and sustainable travel options.
market_insights.competition: Competing destinations include Costa Rica and Belize, with similar attractions focused on nature and culture, but Guatemala’s unique Mayan ruins offer a distinctive draw.

trend_insights.market_trends: There is a rising trend in sustainable travel, with travelers increasingly seeking eco-friendly options and cultural experiences that support local communities.
trend_insights.consumer_behavior: Travelers often prioritize unique experiences and are willing to pay a premium for culturally immersive and eco-friendly options. Flexibility in travel dates is common due to unpredictable weather.
trend_insights.competitive_landscape: Guatemala is positioning itself as a top-tier destination for adventure and cultural tourism, competing effectively against other Central American countries through strong marketing strategies.
trend_insights.seasonal_factors: Travel patterns fluctuate with seasonal weather; peak season aligns with the dry months while the wet season sees a decline in tourists due to rainfall and potential natural hazards.
